executeTask
A function for completing a
business process
task.
The function is available to users with the
"Routes administration"
permission.
Syntax
executeTask
(taskId, [routeId, isAuto, initiator, comment])
Setting
Purpose
taskId
Task to be completed. The parameter must be an instance of the "WF. Process task" [WF_PROCESS_TASK] type (or its ID).
The parameter can be passed as a numeric value or using the
attr
,
param
,
dict
, or
var
functions as an attribute (of "Object" or "Integer" type), parameter, reference value, or variable.
routeId
Transition
option (decision on the task). The parameter must be an instance of the "WorkFlow. Business process transition" [WF_PROCESS_ROUTE] type (or its ID).
The parameter can be passed as a numeric value or using the
attr
,
param
,
dict
, or
var
functions as an attribute (of "Object" or "Integer" type), parameter, reference value, or variable.
This parameter is required if the task has more than one outgoing transition. If a decision is not required (i.e. the task has only one outgoing transition), the value should be set to null.
isAuto
Boolean parameter that determines whether the task can be technically completed without being executed.
The parameter can be passed as a boolean value (
true
/
false
) or using the
attr
or
var
functions as an attribute (of "Boolean" type) or variable.
If the value is
true
or the parameter is not provided, the task will be completed automatically. If the value is
null
or
false
, the task will be completed on behalf of the user who initiated the algorithm, or on behalf of the assignee explicitly specified in the task.
The user/employee on behalf of which the task is executed must have appropriate permissions to complete the task (i.e. be a potential assignee).
This parameter is optional.
initiator
User
or
Employee
on behalf of which the task is run.
The parameter can be passed as a numeric value or using the
attr
,
param
,
dict
, or
var
functions as an attribute (of "Object" or "Integer" type), parameter, reference value, or variable.
This parameter is optional. If not provided or set to _null
, the task will be run on behalf of the user who initiated the algorithm._
The specified user/employee must have permission to complete the task (i.e. be a potential assignee).
comment
Comment text for the task.
The parameter can be passed as a
text value
or using the
attr
,
param
, or
var
functions as an attribute (of "String" or "Text" type), parameter, or variable.
This parameter is optional.
Note
The function is added manually via input.
Example
For example, in the
task settings
for "Order approval", the "Sales department" access group is specified as the assignee.
The task must be completed with the decision "Approved" on behalf of S. Smith, a member of the "Sales department" group.
The algorithm may look like this:
The task is completed using the
executeTask
function, where:
the first parameter uses the
attr
function to set the "ID" attribute of the task being completed;
the second parameter specifies the transition option "Approved" using the
dict
function;
the third parameter is set to "false", meaning the task will be completed on behalf of the assignee;
the fourth parameter uses the
dict
function to select the user S. Smith, on behalf of which the task will be executed;
the fifth parameter specifies the
text
of the task comment.
As a result, the task will be completed, and the specified data will be displayed on the
